I believe this is caused by the same class loading problem that caused bug 
33825. The initialization of these CachedImageDescriptors occurs in a static 
initializer but they reference image descriptors for CVS which are initialized 
on plugin startup. If the static initializer was run before the plugin startup 
code, the above error would occur. 

Code to handle this failure case was added to the CVSUIPlugin#getPlugin() 
method but CVSUIPlugin#getImageDescriptor does not invoke getPlugin() so it 
doesn't wait until the plugin is loaded. This method should be modified to 
perform a getPlugin() so it will wait untiul the plugin is properly initialized.
